definition: (last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
lit. not to know the true face of Lushan Mountain/fig. can't see the forest for the trees
pinyin: bu4 shi4 Lu2 shan1 zhen1 mian4 mu4
